meanings.sent1: The brannigan between the two neighbors could be heard from down the street.
meanings.sent2: The bar erupted into a brannigan after a disagreement over a game of pool.
meanings.sent3: The brannigan at the party was so loud that even the music couldn't drown it out.
meanings.sent4: The political debate turned into a brannigan, with each side shouting over the other.
meanings.sent5: The brannigan in the schoolyard ended with both kids in detention.

meanings.definition: A spree or binge, especially involving drinking.
meanings.sent1: After a long week, he decided to go on a brannigan with his friends to unwind.
meanings.sent2: The group went on a brannigan in celebration of their friend's birthday.
meanings.sent3: The brannigan at the bachelor party lasted until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent4: She regretted the brannigan the next day when she woke up with a headache.
meanings.sent5: The brannigan at the office party led to some embarrassing dance moves.

meanings.sent1: They decided to brannigan it out instead of holding grudges.
meanings.sent2: Let's brannigan tonight and forget about our worries.
meanings.sent3: He branniganed with his brother over who would get the last slice of pizza.
meanings.sent4: The two friends branniganed playfully over who was the better video game player.
meanings.sent5: She branniganed with her cat for the best spot on the couch.
